definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to have dark circles under one's eyes/to have eyes like a panda
erhua variant of 貓眼|猫眼[mao1 yan3]

sentences.english: Wide ovals and sleek cat-eye styles work to diminish fullness.
sentences.chinese: 寬橢圓形和圓滑的貓眼款可以起到收斂圓臉的效果。

sentences.english: The mechanism of thermal transformation for nephrite cat's eye are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 並對軟玉貓眼的熱相變反應機制進行了探討。

sentences.english: Fourth, we can recognize the impressive Nebula Cat's Eye.
sentences.chinese: 第四，我們能夠認識到的令人印象深刻的星雲貓眼石。

sentences.english: The cat's eyes dilated in the darkness.
Miki came, I saw him the spirit of the poor, with two black eye.
sentences.chinese: 美樹過來時，我看見他的精神很差，帶着兩個熊貓眼。

sentences.english: From space, the east coast of Australia appears to be in the embrace of a giant opal.
sentences.chinese: 從空間，澳大利亞東海岸似乎在巨型貓眼石的懷抱中。

sentences.english: If I had that opal , I'd throw it in the river.
sentences.chinese: 如果我得到了那個貓眼石，我寧願把它扔到河裏。

sentences.english: I got sent home from school one day with a shiner on my eye.
sentences.chinese: 有一天我帶着一隻熊貓眼被學校踢回了家。

sentences.english: Unexpectatively my panda eye does so.
sentences.chinese: 想不到我的熊貓眼就這麼練成了。

sentences.english: Today, my girlfriend actually walked into a door and gave herself a black eye.
sentences.chinese: 今天我女朋友不小心在門上撞成了熊貓眼。

sentences.english: The pillars, which were of cedar, were hung with strings of yellow lynx-stones.
sentences.chinese: 雪松的柱子上掛着串串黃色的貓眼石。
但貓眼石，卻可能兼而有之。
但貓眼石，卻可能兼而有之。

sentences.english: Bring the Opal. I'm sure we'll both make a nice profit on this one.
sentences.chinese: 帶貓眼石來，我確定我們兩個將會賺很高的利潤。

sentences.english: Reverse the cat's-eye in your own door.
It's really important that your concealer makeup completely matches your foundation to avoid panda eyes.
sentences.chinese: 用遮瑕妝和眼部化妝來避免熊貓眼真的很主要。

definition: not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
(out of) the corner of one's eyes/peripheral vision/residual light/light of the setting sun
untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
